became a disagreement about whether or not religion should be discussed

April

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] enough already!
messages.msgSnippet: Amen!!  Let s move on.  Susan ... From: Kerry Kibort To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com Sent: 01/25/2001 5:15:30 AM Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] enough
messages.messageBody:
Amen!!  Let's move on.  Susan
----- Original Message -----
From: Kerry Kibort
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
Sent: 01/25/2001 5:15:30 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] enough already!

Ok, I know I dont say much here, but I can't take it
anymore! I loved this list because it WASNT a constant
religous discussion. Now it IS!
I think that there are other lists for discussing this
kind of thing. Lets forget what seperates us and focus
on what brings us together, before my delete button
wears out.
You'll say its all good and we CAN discuss it, but I
can feel the daggers in the words you type, and its
not good for anyone. Egos aside, we are all human (I
think), we are all parents, and we all want whats best
for our children. Jesus, Jehovah, Ragnar.... whatever!
We probably dont agree on what kind of cereal is best,
so lets get on with it!
Sorry if I offended anyone, it wasnt my intention.
Kerry

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] enough already!
messages.msgSnippet: Amen, Kerry!! Wait, I mean I agree wholeheartedly. I just recommended this list to someone who is looking for a place that s less about listen to me! listen
messages.messageBody:
Amen, Kerry!! Wait, I mean I agree wholeheartedly. I just recommended this
list to someone who is looking for a place that's less about "listen to me!
listen to me! I have an opinion!" and more about honest discussion and
helping one another with unschooling questions. Don't make a liar out of me,
guys.

Laura

You'll say its all good and we CAN discuss it, but I

We probably dont agree on what kind of cereal is best,
